```markdown
# dequal [![CI](https://github.com/lukeed/dequal/workflows/CI/badge.svg)](https://github.com/lukeed/dequal/actions)

> A tiny (304B to 489B) utility for deep equality checks in JavaScript.

This module efficiently compares values of various types, including `Function`, `RegExp`, `Date`, `Set`, `Map`, `TypedArray`s, `DataView`, `null`, `undefined`, and `NaN`. Complex structures (objects, arrays, sets, maps) are recursively compared.

> **Important Considerations:**
> * **Object Key Order:** Key order within objects is **ignored** during comparison.
> * **Array Value Order:** Value order within arrays is **important** for equality.
> * **Set/Map Value Equality:** Elements within Sets and Maps are compared for value equality, not reference equality.
> * **Map Key Equality:** Keys within Maps are compared for value equality, not reference equality.


## Installation

```bash
npm install --save dequal
```

## Available Versions

Two optimized versions are available:

#### `dequal`
> **Size (gzip):** ~489 bytes<br>
> **Features:** Comprehensive support for all JavaScript data types, including `Set`, `Map`, and `TypedArray`s.<br>
> **Availability:**  [CommonJS](https://unpkg.com/dequal/dist/index.js), [ES Module](https://unpkg.com/dequal/dist/index.mjs), [UMD](https://unpkg.com/dequal/dist/index.min.js)

#### `dequal/lite`
> **Size (gzip):** ~304 bytes<br>
> **Features:** Optimized for smaller bundle sizes but lacks support for `Set` and `Map` deep equality. <br>
> **Availability:** [CommonJS](https://unpkg.com/dequal/lite/index.js), [ES Module](https://unpkg.com/dequal/lite/index.mjs)

| Feature         | `dequal` | `dequal/lite` |
|-----------------|----------|--------------|
| `Set`, `Map`    | ✅        | ❌           |
| `TypedArray`s  | ✅        | ✅           |
| `DataView`      | ✅        | ✅           |
| Object key order | Ignored   | Ignored    |
| Array value order | Maintained | Maintained |
| Size (gzip)      | ~489 bytes | ~304 bytes  |


## Usage

```javascript
import { dequal } from 'dequal';

console.log(dequal(1, 1));       // true
console.log(dequal({}, {}));       // true
console.log(dequal('foo', 'foo')); // true
console.log(dequal([1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 3])); // true
console.log(dequal(null, null));    // true
console.log(dequal(NaN, NaN));    // true
console.log(dequal([], []));      // true

console.log(dequal({ a: 1 }, { a: 1, b: 2 })); // false (different keys)
console.log(dequal([1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 5]));  // false (different values)
console.log(dequal(/foo/, /bar/));        // false (different regexes)
console.log(dequal(null, undefined));    // false
```

## API

### `dequal(foo, bar)`

Returns: `boolean`

Compares `foo` and `bar` for deep equality. Returns `true` if they are deeply equal, `false` otherwise.  Both arguments can be of any JavaScript type.


## Benchmarks

Performance comparisons are provided in the repository.  Results often show `dequal` performing competitively with other deep equality libraries, particularly for complex objects, while keeping a small footprint.

## License

MIT © [Luke Edwards](https://lukeed.com)
```
